headline: Subsea7 awarded contract in the Mediterranean Sea
summary: Luxembourg – 9 February 2026 - Subsea 7 S.A. (Oslo Børs: SUBC, ADR: SUBCY) today announced the award of a substantial1 contract by Chevron for subsea installation in the Eastern Mediterranean. Subsea7’s scope includes the transport and installation of approximately 17 kilometres of subsea flowlines and umbilicals. Project management and engineering will commence immediately and will be managed by Subsea7’s office in Paris, France. Offshore activities are expected to commence in Q1 2028. David Be

headline: NAMIBIAN INDUSTRY RELATED CATALYSTS SUPPORT STRATEGIC HOLDING OF ASSETS IN MULTIPLE BASINS
summary: Stamper Oil & Gas Corp. (the "Company" or "Stamper") (TSXV: STMP) (US OTC: STMGF) (Germany: TMP0) highlights recent new entrant activity on Petroleum Exploration Licence ("PEL") 104 offshore Namibia in the Lüderitz Basin sit adjacent to Stamper's PEL 107 and PEL 104 assets supporting the Company's strategy of holding four PELs in three of Namibia's four offshore Basins.

headline: Major Australian Iron Ore Ports Reopen as Cyclone Risk Falls
summary: Port Hedland in northwest Australia resumed operations on Sunday as Tropical Cyclone Mitchell headed south, while the Ports of Dampier, Ashburton, Cape Preston West and Varanus Island resumed activities on Monday, operator Pilbara Ports said on its website.  The ports handle the bulk of Australia’s iron ore exports, from major miners including BHP Group, Rio Tinto Group, and Fortescue Ltd., as well as liquefied natural gas cargoes from Woodside Energy Group Ltd. and Chevron Corp.
